page.title: 12Population and housing
page.content: The survey area is constantly under pressure for the development of new housing. The villages are becoming increasingly popular to live in, and the Green Belt surrounding Cheltenham has resulted in houses having to be built further away. Very few building developments are permitted within the Green Belt. The present Government has tried (so far unsuccessfully)to relax the regulations concerning Green Belts. New houses tend to be of the larger and more expensive 'four bedroomed detached' type and on average cost more than Â£60,000 to buy. Some modern houses in Gotherington have recently been sold for more than Â£80,000 each. Older propertites, those considered of 'character' and built of traditional Cotswold stone are especially popular.
